mdRecord.dcterms:title: The People to the President: German melody: O Tannebaum, O Tannebaum, wie grün sind deine Blätter. : Air--Maryland, My Maryland / By a Lady of Washington City
Oh, let the Constitution stand, Abraham, our Abraham
To the President
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Lady of Washington City. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Civil war song sheet in 5 verses; without music; printed in blue in 2 columns on illustrated letter paper, with verso of sheet ruled in blue. [original]
First line of text: Oh, let the Constitution stand, Abraham, our Abraham. [original]
With advertisement "500 Illustrated Ballads lithographed and printed by Charles Magnus, No. 12 Frankfort Street, New York[.] Branch office, No. 520 7th St., Washington, D.C." [original]
Charles Magnus published as an individual at 12 Frankfort St., New York, between 1860 and 1867. Works which also include his Washington, D.C. imprint were published about 1863 and 1864. [original]
Hand-colored headpiece with caption "U.S. Troops descending the Mississippi, escorted by Gunboat." Magnus 121. Cf. American song sheets, 1867b. [original]
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Sixth of 25 song sheets which were mounted in an unidentified scrapbook. Rehoused, 2009. [original]
